roleset.name: to accept enthusiastically or to include

example.name: transitive
example.text: The AFL-CIO also embraces treatment guidelines .

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: In the last decade , many corporations have embraced the `` utilization management '' cost containment strategy as a way [0] [*]to control health-care costs for employees [*T*] .
example.arg: the `` utilization management '' cost containment strategy

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Its passionate embrace of this reporter who after all was facing jail
example.arg: of this reporter who after all was facing jail

example.name: arg 1 only
example.text: an embrace of tolerance and diversity

roleset.note: EMBRACE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'embrace' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from embrace.01-v predicate notes)
EMBRACE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'embrace.01-v'. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from embrace.01-n)

roleset.name: to hug, hug

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Standing 17 meters tall and 18 meters wide , it 's a gold dragon embracing a globe , and it is supposed to convey the idea of a dragon bringing good luck to the world .

example.name: just arg0
example.text: ne child , in a mother 's embrace / Such a sweet smile , at the sight of her face ...
